lq.p: Some borrowing agreements incorporate undertakings by the borrower (covenants) which have the effect that the liability becomes payable on demand if certain conditions related to the borrower’s financial position are breached. In these circumstances, the liability is classified as non‑current only when:

li.p: the lender has agreed, prior to the authorisation of the financial statements for issue, not to demand payment as a consequence of the breach; and
it is not probable that further breaches will occur within twelve months of the balance sheet date.
